citations.narrative:
The wooden thresholds for the doorways to the outdoor runs of 2 of the indoor kennels were damaged from the dogs
chewing the wood, exposing rough unsealed wood surfaces that are no longer impervious to moisture.
Per this Section, the floors and walls of indoor housing facilities, and any other surfaces in contact with the animals, must
be impervious to moisture. Surfaces that are not impervious to moisture cannot be effectively cleaned and sanitized. In
addition, chewing on the damaged thresholds can result in splintering of the wood and possible injury to the dogs’ oral
tissues from the splinters. A work order was submitted to campus maintenance during the inspection to repair/replace the
damaged thresholds. Correct by 11/20/23.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representatives.
*END OF REPORT*
